pullRequest.title: added allowSerializedAccess, maxWaitTime and accessOnTimeout to metatype.properties
pullRequest.bodyText: added allowSerializedAccess, maxWaitTime and accessOnTimeout to metatype.properties

commit.message: added allowSerializedAccess, maxWaitTime and accessOnTimeout to metatype.xml and metatype.properties

nodes.bodyText: Change "a session before continuing execution" to "a session before it continues execution".
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -136,4 +136,13 @@ extraProperties.name=Additional properties
 extraProperties.description=Additional properties related to session management.
 
 modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.name=Modify active count on invalidated session
-modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
\ No newline at end of file
+modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
+
+allow.serialized.access.name=Allow serialized access
+allow.serialized.access.description=Enable this option to allow serializing access to session data.
+
+max.wait.time.name=Max wait time
+max.wait.time.description=The amount of time, in milliseconds, a servlet waits on a session before continuing execution.

nodes.bodyText: Change "allowing normal execution" to "which allows normal execution".
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -136,4 +136,13 @@ extraProperties.name=Additional properties
 extraProperties.description=Additional properties related to session management.
 
 modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.name=Modify active count on invalidated session
-modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
\ No newline at end of file
+modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
+
+allow.serialized.access.name=Allow serialized access
+allow.serialized.access.description=Enable this option to allow serializing access to session data.
+
+max.wait.time.name=Max wait time
+max.wait.time.description=The amount of time, in milliseconds, a servlet waits on a session before continuing execution.
+
+access.on.timeout.name=Access on timeout
+access.on.timeout.description=This property gives the servlet access to the session, allowing normal execution even if the session is still locked by another servlet. Default is true, set to false makes the servlet execution abort when the session requests a time out.

commit.message: made changes to the metatype.properties file to incorporate the comments provided

nodes.bodyText:
Enable this option to allow serializing access to session data.
Why is it "serializing" in the description but "serialized" in the name? What's the distinction? If there is none, they should both be "serialized"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -136,4 +136,13 @@ extraProperties.name=Additional properties
 extraProperties.description=Additional properties related to session management.
 
 modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.name=Modify active count on invalidated session
-modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
\ No newline at end of file
+modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
+
+allow.serialized.access.name=Allow serialized access
+allow.serialized.access.description=Enable this option to allow serializing access to session data.

nodes.bodyText:
...Default is true, set to false to make the servlet execution abort when the session requests a time out.
suggested edit:
Set this property to false to stop the servlet execution when the session requests a timeout. The default value is true.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -136,4 +136,13 @@ extraProperties.name=Additional properties
 extraProperties.description=Additional properties related to session management.
 
 modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.name=Modify active count on invalidated session
-modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
\ No newline at end of file
+modify.active.count.on.invalidated.session.description=Httpsession activeCount metric might become inaccurate when the session is accessed by multiple applications. Set the property to "false" to resolve the issue.
+
+allow.serialized.access.name=Allow serialized access
+allow.serialized.access.description=Enable this option to allow serializing access to session data.
+
+max.wait.time.name=Max wait time
+max.wait.time.description=The amount of time, in milliseconds, a servlet waits on a session before it continues execution.
+
+access.on.timeout.name=Access on timeout
+access.on.timeout.description=This property gives the servlet access to the session, which allows normal execution even if the session is still locked by another servlet. Default is true, set to false to make the servlet execution abort when the session requests a time out.

commit.message: Made requested changes to the metatype.properties

nodes.bodyText:
Change "in milliseconds" to "in seconds" in max.wait.time.description.
The code will convert to millisecond:
long syncSessionTimeOut = (long)_smc.getSerializedSessionAccessMaxWaitTime() * 1000L; //convert to millisecond
